title: Beware Security Issues
comment: My recommendation is this: Use coinbase for all your trades, and then empty your wallet to get your money to a wallet that you actually can control.  I love Coinbase. Coinbase is my exchange of choice when it comes to purchasing or selling bitcoins, but I do not recommend that anyone keep bitcoins in their wallets.    The problem with the Coinbase Wallet is that they keep your private keys, so your money is never really yours until you send it to a different wallet.  As evidence to this fact, after you download and use the Coinbase application on your phone, you will see your wallets both on your phone and through the web on their web server.  The web server can only see your unspent outputs and spend them if the web server has the private key.  Furthermore, not only does the web server have your private key (and thus the ability to spend your money as they see fit), but, because you do not ever hold a copy of the private key, Coinbase is able to lock you out from accessing your own funds. This is just not a secure setup for end users.  Coinbase has appeared in Bitcoiner Blogs and the news for having "frozen" accounts.  So, use Coinbase, absolutely!, but beware!

title: Easy way to buy BTC but encourages address reuse

It would be nice to enable a setting to make a new address for each new receiver transaction, and to present a bar code for those new addresses when requesting money rather than forcing the request through email.

Rod - You can request BTC with QR code by again again going to the overflow menu section in a wallet and then selecting my address. You can then share the address with your friends via email, Facebook, message etc.
